attributes.action: Create strict ethical laws governing the British Fashion/Retail Industry
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We the undersigned believe stricter laws should be passed governing how British businesses connected to the retail fashion industry can operate. The aim; to reduce bad labour practices abroad and encourage greater environmental culpability amongst companies ie including tighter guidelines for manufacturing and the materials sourced. We have minimum wage eastablished in this country and we should expect nothing less than a miniumum wage for those who make our clothes. Please, also provide incentives for the habitual and widespread sourcing "green" materials such as organic cotton in retail business as opposed to environmental damaging crops using pesticides.

rejection.details: The government cannot legislate on behalf of other countries.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
